alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:13PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kit Carson County through 1145 PM MDT... At 1113 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Stratton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Kit Carson County. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 414 and 422. Highway 385 between mile markers 170 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
